item.title: Venezuela Will Be No Panama
item.description: History suggests that an effort to overthrow Nicolás Maduro could be disastrous for the region and ultimately harm the U.S.

item.title: Big Tech’s Predatory Platform Model Doesn’t Have to Be Our Future
item.description: Innovation comes from a less centralized tech sector.

item.title: The Corruption Behind Trump’s East Wing Demolition
item.description: As of Oct. 24, the White House’s East Wing is all but a pile of debris. The New York Times Opinion’s editor Kathleen Kingsbury unpacks the public outrage and reveals why you should be concerned about this move by President Trump.

item.title: Trump’s Path of Destruction Is Far-Reaching
item.description: From Venezuela to the East Wing of the White House.

item.title: Will New York Voters Choose to Speed Up Housing Construction?
item.description: Three measures on the ballot would revise cumbersome approval procedures.

item.title: Why Trump’s East Wing Demolition Needed to Happen
item.description: The arguments against it illustrate a consistent problem with progressive stewardship of American cities.

item.title: How Can Democrats Win Back the Working Class?
item.description: Jared Abbott, the director of the Center for Working-Class Politics, discusses what it would take for Democrats to better appeal to working-class voters.

item.title: Why You Should Savor This World Series
item.description: A new system next season will help perfect decisions around balls and strikes. But baseball’s charm has always been tied to its imperfections.

item.title: Peru Shows How Democracies Die Even Without a Dictator
item.description: What happens when the state doesn’t curb predatory private powers?

item.title: The Privilege of Prince Andrew
item.description: The inordinate gilded privilege of being a member of the royal family takes anything but the strongest character and ruins all the good in it.

item.title: Burnin’ Down the House
item.description: Demolition Man builds a monument to his wrecking-ball style.

item.title: What I’d Tell a Younger Version of Myself About Having a Baby
item.description: Reporting on pregnancy didn’t stop me from experiencing its joy.

item.title: How Trump and Xi Can Stop a War Before It Starts
item.description: Dangerous close calls are rising, but the U.S. and China still lack the communication channels needed to stop a crisis from becoming a war.

item.title: There’s a Reason Trump Fears No Kings
item.description: Who’s the patriot now?

item.title: Why Rural America Turned on the Democratic Party
item.description: President Trump’s deployment of the National Guard from red states into blue cities isn’t just a partisan attack; it’s also a geographic one.

item.title: The Rot Creeping Into Our Minds
item.description: Yes, Trump is assaulting democracy, but what worries me more is what has happened to the rest of us — the loss of the convictions and norms that undergird democracy.

item.title: The U.S. and Europe Are Trying New Ways to Pressure Russia
item.description: For the first time in his second term, President Trump is imposing new sanctions, but they may not shift the course of Russia’s war in Ukraine.

item.title: The Secretive Office Approving Trump’s Boat Strikes
item.description: Our government is once again committing human rights abuses on the ostensible authority of a legal opinion that is being kept secret from the public.

item.title: Why We Can’t All Get Along, and What to Do About It
item.description: Readers respond to an essay about whether we can break the present cycle of heated and sometimes violent disagreement.

item.title: How Netflix’s Nuclear War Movie Holds Up to the Real World
item.description: ‘A House of Dynamite’ presents a terrifying glimpse of the modern nuclear risk.

item.title: Crypto and Trump Corrupted America
item.description: Trump has bared the corruption at the heart of crypto and the libertarian ideas behind it.

item.title: Is the A.I. Boom Just Vibes?
item.description: Are we living through an A.I. bubble? Or is it all just vibes? Jason Furman, a contributing Opinion writer and an economist at the Harvard Kennedy School, tells Ross Douthat that while it’s hard to put a number on it, “there’s something enormous going on here.”

item.title: I Resented the White House Bitterly. Now I Mourn It.
item.description: The East Wing was where Eleanor Roosevelt walked. It was where Jacqueline Kennedy planned the Rose Garden. Now it’s all but gone.

item.title: Mikie Sherrill Should Win in New Jersey
item.description: Why Mikie Sherrill’s chances in New Jersey are much better than you might be hearing.

item.title: How Women Destroyed the West
item.description: The new right pines for a story that would vindicate its reactionary rage.

item.title: Why Everyone Is Obsessed With the Louvre Heist
item.description: It’s not that people are salivating at the idea of criminality, but some are amused by the robbery.

item.title: How Trump Should Think About the A.I. Bubble
item.description: Will the Trump administration offer a financial bailout if the A.I. bubble bursts? Jason Furman, a contributing Opinion writer and an economist at the Harvard Kennedy School, explains what President Trump’s investments tell us about his priorities in the event of a crash.

item.title: The Next Economic Bubble Is Here
item.description: OpenAI is worth more than Goldman Sachs. Here’s what that means for the economy.

item.title: Some of the Greatest American Music You’ve Never Heard Of
item.description: Why has the genius of these Black innovators been consigned to academic conferences?

item.title: Trump Has a Religion. What Do Democrats Have?
item.description: Mamdani might be working in Democrats’ favor. But what about “No Kings”?

item.title: The East Wing Is History, in More Ways Than One
item.description: Readers respond to the demolition of the East Wing of the White House. Also: Fending off tyranny; when Black women are fired.

item.title: The Democratic Party Is Getting Too Rich to Win
item.description: Democrats used to be known as the party of the poor and the working class. Two decades of federal income data show how that changed.

item.title: When Republicans Go Low …
item.description: What’s the smart move for Democrats in this political moment? On “The Opinions,” the columnist David Brooks says he thinks the party should channel Michelle Obama and “go high.”

item.title: The ‘No Kings’ Movement Is Missing Something Big
item.description: The Opinion columnist David Brooks, a center-right thinker, feels as if there’s room for him in the “No Kings” movement. “It’s pro-American. It’s basically in line with the cultural DNA of this country, and so I’m very impressed by it,” he says. And yet, he argues, the movement is still missing something essential.

item.title: Mamdani and Cuomo Debated Housing Policy, but Both Need to Think Bigger
item.description: New York has urgent housing needs. Mamdani is leading the race for mayor because of his awareness of this. But all the candidates should have bigger plans.

item.title: Thanks a Lot, Boomers
item.description: Hey, boomers! Younger Americans would like a word. We’ve noticed that many of you are pretty upset about the state of the nation. And we get it. We really do. But do you ever stop and ask yourselves how we got here?

item.title: What Happened in Gaza Might Be Even Worse Than We Think
item.description: We have a chance to discover the true cost of this war.

item.title: Members of Congress Don’t Leave. We Need Term Limits.
item.description: It’s a reform that would help bring our divided nation together.

item.title: The Connection Between the Fort Bragg Cartel and the ‘Department of War’
item.description: The adventurism and impunity of the Cold War live on in the modern military.

item.title: What’s Lost When Liberal Arts Schools Close
item.description: Small colleges secure the fraying social fabric that holds towns together.

item.title: Trump Revives Foreign Aid, Helping Needy Billionaires
item.description: As children die for want of cheap medicines, the U.S. spends billions on Argentina — thus rescuing rich investors who made bad bets.

item.title: Trump’s Ballroom Is a National ‘Desecration’
item.description: Readers respond to the makeover of the East Wing of the White House. Also: President Trump’s demand for compensation from the Justice Department.

item.title: The Worst Losers in Trump’s Economy
item.description: Massive cuts to health, education and immigration are disproportionately taking a toll.

item.title: Trump Wants the American People to Pay Him $230 Million
item.description: Trump should pay a political price for his brazen corruption. Instead, he is telling American taxpayers to pay a price, directly to him.
